Excellent plan! You're on the right track to improving your strength, power, and endurance on the court. Remember to start slowly, progress gradually, and listen to your body. It's essential to balance strength and conditioning exercises with on-court practice to avoid fatigue and prevent injuries.

Here are some additional tips to keep in mind:

* **Warm up and cool down**: Always warm up before strength and conditioning exercises, and cool down afterwards to prevent injuries and promote recovery.
* **Focus on proper form**: Make sure to learn and practice proper form and technique for each exercise to avoid injuries and get the most out of your workout.
* **Incorporate variety**: Mix up your exercises and routines to avoid plateaus and prevent overuse injuries.
* **Make it fun**: Find exercises and routines that you enjoy, and make strength and conditioning a part of your tennis journey.

Remember, strength and conditioning is just one aspect of improving your tennis game. Don't forget to also work on your technique, tactics, and mental toughness.

How do you feel about tracking your progress and setting goals for your strength and conditioning routine?
